The following table shows a list of steps that can be followed to find the inverse of a function. They are not in the correct order.

A Write the new equation for ùë•x in terms of ùë¶y:
B Original function:
C Replace all ùë•x variables with ùë¶y and vice versa:
D Inverse equation of the original function:
E Move the constant to the other side of the equation:
F Divide the equation through by the coefficient of ùë¶y:

Select the appropriate sentence from the options given above to complete the description for each step of finding the inverse of the function ùë¶=18ùë•‚àí14y=18x‚àí14.

Answer:
ùë¶=18ùë•‚àí14y=18x‚àí14
ùë•=18ùë¶‚àí14x=18y‚àí14
ùë•+14=18ùë¶x+14=18y
ùë•+1418=ùë¶x+1418=y
ùë¶=ùë•18+79y=x18+79
